poem:
### Inquiries

Endless lines of questions,
Grenfell's ashes whisper,
shadows of the children,
Brook House echoes with silence,
troops' war-torn faces,
each thread unwinds—
hollow promises spin,
twisting in the cold wind.
Misery deepens,
justice delayed,
wounds still open.

No solace in the empty rooms
only stories unspoken,
pain unhealed.
